title: Hard water
creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, Michael Clarke, Unilever Films and View Point
brief_description: Rain falling to earth as a weak acid reaches the tap as a solution of ionic compounds. Soap reacts with these compounds to form insoluble calcium soap, precipitated as scum, while soapless detergents form soluble acid salts. Gives an explanation of water softening by ion exchange.
